newsitem.title: USA: INTERVIEW-Netscape sees Q3 product boost.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW-Netscape sees Q3 product boost.

text.p: A senior Netscape Communications Corp. executive said the company's newly shipped Communicator and SuiteSpot 3.0 products will provide a big boost to results in the third quarter.

"Clearly there's a big impact for Q3," the executive, Senior Vice President of Marketing Mike Homer, said in an interview. "There's some impact on Q2 (but) it's hard to tell." how big the impact will be this quarter.

Homer, speaking after a news briefing in which Netscape announced its support of Sun Microsystems Inc.'s JavaBeans initiative, said the company was pleased with its strategic decision to target the large enterprise market with client and server products.

Homer repeated his prediction that he expects Microsoft not to release its Internet Explorer 4.0 browser product for at least five months, giving Netscape an critical advantage in the fast-moving Internet business.
"I think they made a very strategic mistake, which is hooking it up to Windows," he said of the Microsoft browser. (sam.perry@reuters.com, Palo Alto Bureau 415 846 5400)
